ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: angle-dependent reflection from an ionized disk. XSpec convolution model *Experimental*.

DESC.PARA: This model is described in the XSPEC manual.

When using this model it is essential to extend the energy range over which the model is calculated because photons at higher energies are Compton down-scattered into the target energy range. Please contact the CXC HelpDesk if you need to do this.

ROW.DATA: the relative reflection normalization; if negative then only the reflected component is returned
iron abundance relative to Solar. All other elements are assumed to have Solar abundance.
log(xi); the ionization parameter used by the table models.
The exponential cut-off energy in keV.

DESC.PARA: Please see ahelp xsconvolve for information on how to load the model.

LIST.CAPTION: Notes
LIST.ITEM: This is an experimental release of the convolution models; please take care when using this model.
Sherpa does not have an equivalent of the extend command in X-Spec.

DESC.PARA: This information is taken from the XSpec User's Guide. Version 12.9.1n of the XSpec models is supplied with CIAO 4.10.
